data.title: GALLERY RECYCLES OBJECTS OF DESIRE
data.meta_description: Reselling art works, a kind of aesthetic recycling, ensures that the relationship between dealers, artists and collectors remains fluid and vital. Although dealers concentrate on selling recent work by the artists they represent, they are not all averse to buying work back from clients or negotiating trade-ins on newer pieces. For the new art collector the opportunity of buying from a commercial space provides a leisurely alternative to the pressure of the auction room.
data.text:
Reselling art works, a kind of aesthetic recycling, ensures that the relationship between dealers, artists and collectors remains fluid and vital. Although dealers concentrate on selling recent work by the artists they represent, they are not all averse to buying work back from clients or negotiating trade-ins on newer pieces. For the new art collector the opportunity of buying from a commercial space provides a leisurely alternative to the pressure of the auction room.

Chris Deutscher, who runs Deutscher Fine Art in the Melbourne suburb of Malvern, has held regular sales of work from private collections for more than 15 years. The latest, Australian Art, Colonial to Contemporary, features more than 120 works, from the 1840s to the present.
